loans.name: Baby

texts.en: This is 36-year-old Baby. She is married and has two children, aged 10 and 7 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her as a sales assistant.  In 2007, Baby established her pharmacy business. She began her business because she wanted to help her family. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her customers are all types of people. Working 7 days a week and 18 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Baby requires a loan in order to purchase more drugs to sell. She hopes that this loan will support her through proper use. In the future, Baby plans to become a supplier of drugs to other retailers and to educate her children to a university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more pharmaceutical drugs to sell

loans.name: Maramou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1975, MARAMOU vit avec ses 6 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire à MANA dans la commune rurale de Ouelessebougou. 
MARAMOU s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa tante qui faisait le commerce de céréales. MARAMOU, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour l’achat vente de céréales, d’arachide, de niébé, de  dah, etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les quatre prêts précédents, MARAMOU est à son cinquième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  30 sacs de mil, auprès des paysans producteurs (à OUELESSEBOUGOU, KELEYA et OUROUN) et quelques rare fois avec les  grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de Ouelessebougou et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de consommateurs. 
MARAMOU espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1975, Maramou lives with her six children and her husband in Mana, in the rural commune of Ouelessebougou. She lives in a nuclear family.

She got involved in income-generating activities at a young age, learning from an aunt who was selling grains. After many years of experience working with her aunt, she decided to start buying and selling grains, groundnut, black-eyed peas, bissap etc.

Having duly repaid four previous loans, Maramou is taking her fifth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. She will use her loan to buy 30 bags of millet from rural producers in Ouelessebougou, Keleya and Ouroun and very occasionally from local wholesalers. She sells for cash or on credit to a retail customer base which mainly consists of consumers. She sells from home, at the Ouelessebougou market and other surrounding markets.

She is hoping to make a monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs which will be used in part to help her husband take care of the family's needs and repay her loan, while the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Kandeh

texts.en: This is 28-year-old Kandeh. He is single and has no children. In 2011, Kandeh established his grocery store. He began his business because he was unable to complete his schooling due to financial constrains. His business is located in the outskirts of town, and his customers are all classes of people. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 300,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Kandeh requires a loan in order to increase his stock and earn more money. He hopes that this loan will help his business grow. Kandeh plans to further his education in the next two years. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Emma Bundu

texts.en: This is 45-year-old Emma. She is married and has three children, aged 25, 16, and 10 years. In 1979, Emma established her beans, wallah rice, and tolla selling business. She began her business because she did not go to school. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are market buyers. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 850,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Emma requires a loan in order to increase her stock, such as buying more local food items to sell. She hopes that this loan will support her. In the future, Emma plans to finish her building and educate her children to a university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Es empleado en una empresa y además es estudiante de Administración. Sus ingresos son bajos por lo cual ayuda con lo que puede en su hogar ya que además debe pagar sus estudios.

Requiere el crédito por que es su último año en la Universidad y los gastos son un mucho más elevados, pues tendrá que pagar por los títulos y certificaciones, además de la matrícula.

El sueño de Juan es salir profesional y poder acceder a un mejor trabajo y así poder ayudar mejor en su casa con los gastos.
texts.en:
Juan is single and lives at his parents' home, within the Alto San Pedro zone in La Paz.  He works for a company and is also a student of management.  His income is low but he helps however he can in the home and must also pay for his schooling.

He needs this loan because this will be his final year at university.  The expenses are high and he must pay for titles and certifications, as well as tuition.

Juan's dream is to become a professional and be able to get a better job and be better able to help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to pay university expenses and tuition.

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
BENDIYA est un groupe de l’association DANAYA de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, sont mariées et ont en moyenne cinq enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment alimentaire à l’image de KADIATOU  qui est la seule personne assise dans la chaise. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe décident d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
KADIATOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de condiment alimentaire. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 1 sac de pâte d’arachide, 1 sac d’oignons et un colis de poivres.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
BENDIYA is a group which is part of the DANAYA association of Ouelessebougou.  It comprises four married women who know one another through family and neighborhood ties.  These women have an average age of 45 and an average of five children each.  They are involved in various activities:  Kadiatou, for example, buys and sells condiments. (In the photo, Kadiatou is the only woman sitting in a chair). These four women live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou, in the cercle of Kati (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

The members of the group have been involved in small retail activities for several years and their products are in high demand.  Eager to meet the increasing needs of their customers, they have decided to join the loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso.  This is their first solidarity loan.

Kadiatou, the group's leader, is quite well-known in Ouelessebougou.  She excels in the sale of condiments.  She will use her loan to buy one bag of groundnut paste, one bag of onions and one package of pepper.  She buys her goods from local wholesalers or in Bamako.  She resells her products in Ouelessebougou, for cash or on credit, to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

Kadiatou hopes to make a monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs, which will help her to repay her loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo SANTA LUCIA está en su ciclo 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio de su trabajo. Ellas han hecho le encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les permite medir sus ingresos, y muestra que dos de las señoras tiene un ingreso muy bajo.
Rumilda es una de ellas, y sus ingresos según la encuesta están muy bajo. Ella pese a todo se esfuerza por salir adelante y mejorar su vida y la de su familia. Ella se dedica a la cría de animales de corral, cuenta que es muy sacrificado, ya que tiene que estar pendiente todo el tiempo de sus animales. Por medio de los ingresos que ella tiene está dando a su familia lo que está a su alcance.
Ella solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de animales de corral, como así también de balanceados para poder seguir con su trabajo y lograr mejorar así su economía.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucía group is in its first loan cycle in the women's committee program, in which they're learning to work together and help each other mutually through their work.  They have done the poverty elimination survey that allows them to measure their income, which indicates that two of the members have a very low income.

Rumilda is one of them and her income is very low according to the survey.  In spite of everything, she makes the effort to get ahead and improve her life and that of her family.  She makes a living raising farm animals.  She says it's very demanding because she has to be looking after the animals all the time.  With her income she's giving her family what's within her reach.

She's requesting this loan to invest in buying farm animals as well as balanced feed to be able to continue with her job and improve her finances.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja, está separada y tiene dos hijos de los cuales el mayor es independiente y solo vive con el menor el cual está en secundaria; vive en la casa de su suegra ocupando solo una habitación pequeña con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto San Isidro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de ocho horas vendiendo pisos para vehículos en una feria en la ciudad de El Alto en un puesto en la calle y con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación , estudios y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar  y variar su mercadería(comprará pisos de autos y limpia parabrisas) ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos para adquirir una casa en anticrético para mejorar su calidad de vida y tener más comodidad.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Maruja is separated and has two children of which the older one is independent and lives alone while the younger one is in secondary school. She lives in her mother-in-law's house occupying just one small room with adobe walls and a dirt floor. The house is located in the Alto San Isidro neighborhood in the city of La Paz. 

Presently she works over eight hours selling floor mats for vehicles in a fair in the city of El Alto in a street stall, and with what little she earns she must cover the cost of food, studies and payment of basic services for her family.

She requires the loan to increase the quantity and assortment of her merchandise (she will buy auto floor mats and windshield wipers) since she wishes to improve her income to rent a house through anticretico [a special type of contract in Bolivia] to improve her quality of life and to be more comfortable. This is her third time requesting a loan from IMPRO and the second time together with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy floor mats for cars and windshield wipers to continue with her business selling those items at a fair in the city of El Alto

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and accessories

loans.name: Costureras Group

texts.es:
La señora Lucia Celestina es casada, tiene 33 años de edad, estudio 2 años de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, inició este negocio con 4 pollitos y hasta la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamos que lo utilizará para la compra de 6 docenas de pollo y compra de concentrado para alimentarlos, en el futuro quiere tener una granja de pollos de engorde como tambien de gallinas ponedoras; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a crianza de pollos y a vender verduras.
texts.en:
Lucia Celestina is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children, one of whom is in school.  She has a 2nd grade education.  Lucia Celestina has a business raising broiler chickens.  She started the business with 4 chicks, and she now has 5 years of experience.

She has organized a group to request a loan.  She will use her loan to buy 6 dozen chickens and chicken feed.  In the future, she wants to have a chicken farm with broilers and laying hens.  The other members of this group raise chickens and sell vegetables.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Anne J.

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Anne. She is married and has four children aged 18, 12, 9, and 3 years. In 2001, Anne established her pharmacy business. She began her business because of low salary income. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are people of the general community. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about SLL 600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Anne requires a loan in order to buy more drugs for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her. In the future, Anne plans to become a drugstore owner and open a pharmacy in a different business outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for resale

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 27-year-old Isatu. She is married and has two children, both aged seven years (twins). She has two additional dependents who live with her for schooling. In 2001, Isatu established her cosmetics business. She began her business because she wants to help her husband in the smooth running of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are people of the general community. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more cosmetics like hair gel, Vaseline, body cream, etc. for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her. In the future, Isatu plans to become an international businesswoman and give quality education to her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos de 34 años de edad es padre de un hijo de 7 años. Toda su vida ha residido en el campo, lo que lo convierte en un gran agricultor. Se dedica a la siembra de cultivos de papa criolla, arveja, zanahoria y  a la producción y venta de leche, actividades que aprendió por tradición familiar. 
Las hortalizas son comercializadas en el mercado del pueblo y la leche entre sus vecinos de su comunidad. 
Carlos se encuentra necesitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vaca lechera con la que espera aumentar la capacidad de producción, aumentando sus ingresos y mejorando el bienestar de su familia y garantizándole a su hijo el acceso a la educación.
texts.en:
Carlos is 34 years old and the father of a 7-year-old son. All his life he has resided in the country, which makes him a great farmer. He makes a living planting crops of potatoes, peas and carrots and through the production and sale of milk, activities passed down to him through family tradition.

The vegetables are sold in the village market and the milk among his neighbors in the community. Carlos needs a loan that he will invest in the purchase of a dairy cow with which he hopes to increase his production capacity, increasing his income and improving the welfare of his family and guaranteeing his son access to education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo de 55 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos. Se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo desde hace más de 16 años, debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar y la educación de sus dos hijos. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza y uso personal, con el fin de garantizarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio y aumentar su nivel de ingresos que le garantice una mejor calidad de vida. 
Su mayor sueño es montar una tienda de ropas en la sala de su residencia.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 55, is the mother of two children.  She has made a living selling catalogue products for more than 16 years because she needs to generate income to support her household and her children's education.

Currently she's requesting a loan to invest in buying beauty and personal care products.  Her goal is to give her customers better service and increase her income level so she has a better quality of life.

Her biggest dream is to set up a clothing store in the living room of her house.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Carmen Alina

texts.es:
Carmen de 51 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y con muchos sueños por cumplir. Desde hace diez años inició la creación de su propio negocio dedicado al servicio de troquelado para cajas. Hoy siente que este ha sido su mayor logro en la vida ya que con esta actividad ha podido mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Su mayor sueño es seguir creciendo en el mercado local y posicionar su servicio. 
En la actualidad, Carmen carece de recursos económicos para realizar el mantenimiento de las máquinas, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que le permita reactivar su negocio e incrementar el volumen de ventas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 51 years old and is an enterprising woman with many dreams to achieve. Ten years ago she began building her own business dedicated to die-cutting services for boxes. Today she feels like this has been the biggest success in her life since this activity has allowed her to improve her family's living conditions. Her greatest dream is to continue growing in the local market and to position her service. 

Presently, Carmen lacks the economic resources to carry out maintenance on her machines, which is why she is requesting a loan which will permit her to revive her business and to increase the volume of sales.

loans.use: to maintain a die-cutting machine

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: En la búsqueda de alternativas para generar ingresos que le permitieran sostener su hogar y velar por la educación de sus tres hijos, Gonzalo de 55 años de edad, recurrió a su experiencia como comerciante y opto por emprender la creación de su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar. Hoy su tienda se encuentra posicionada en el sector, por lo cual desea permanecer como pionero en el mercado y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de productos que sus clientes le sugieren constantemente. Su mayor sueño es seguir creciendo y convertir su negocio en un gran supermercado.
texts.en:
In search of alternative ways to generate income that would permit him to sustain his home and cover the education of his three children, 55-year-old Gonzalo turned to his experience as a merchant and chose to undertake the creation of his own business dedicated to selling products for the family shopping basket.

Today his store is positioned in the sector and he wants to remain a pioneer in the market. For this reason, he is requesting a loan that will be invested in the purchase of products that his customers constantly ask for.

His biggest dream is to continue growing and to convert his business into a grand supermarket.

loans.use: to buy products for the family shopping basket

loans.name: Gladis María

texts.es:
Gladis María de 41 años de edad es madre soltera de dos hijos. Debido al abandono de su esposo, asumió las obligaciones del hogar, por lo cual inició trabajando en el restaurante de su madre que lleva 30 años en el mercado. Desde hace seis años, Gladis es la nueva propietario luego del fallecimiento de su madre.
Labora diariamente hasta las 8:00 pm. Y en la actualidad genera un empleo directo.  Su mayor dificultad, asegura Gladis es la competencia del sector por ser altamente comercial, pero manifiesta que esta también es una gran ventaja que le exige ser mejor para ser pionero en el servicio de alimentación.

En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para adecuaciones locativas con el propósito de ofrecer un servicio de calidad y fidelización de sus clientes. Espera mejorar sus condiciones de vida y brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de ingresas a la educación superior.
texts.en:
Gladis Maria is a 41 year old single mother of two children.  After her husband left, she assumed all the household obligations.  She began working in the restaurant her mother owned for 30 years.  Six years ago, Gladis took over ownership after her mother passed away.  She works daily until 8:00 pm.  Gladis' major obstacle is her competition since it is vastly commercial.  However, she sees this as a great advantage as it forces her to be better and to be a pioneer in food service. 

Currently, Gladis is applying for this loan to renovate the restaurant.  This will allow her to offer quality service and gain loyalty from her customers.  She also hopes to better her quality of life and to be able to afford the opportunity for her children to have a superior education.

loans.use: to make renovations to her restaurant.

loans.name: Ándres Avelino

texts.es: Andrés tiene 25 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Desde hace quince años se dedica a la pesca artesanal y lo aprendió de su padre. El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales para construir su casa; ya que donde vive esta elaborada de lamina y es muy pequeña. Al construir su casa, su familia vivirá más segura, cómoda y tranquila. Su objetivo es continuar trabajando por mejorar cada día sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Andrés is 25 years old and has a son. Since he was 15 years old he has worked in artesanal fishing, a trade he learned from his father. 

The loan he is requesting from Fundacion Campo is for the purchase of materials to construct his house, since the place he currently lives is crafted from sheet metal and is very small. Upon constructing his house, his family will live more securely, comfortably and peacefully. 

His objective is to continue working to improve his living conditions every day.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct his house, since the place he currently lives is crafted from sheet metal and is very small

loans.name: José Jesús

texts.es:
José de 46 años de edad es padre de 3 hijos a los cuales adora y por quienes trabaja día a día con el ánimo de brindarles una buena educación, alimentación y hogar. El señor José se dedica al cultivo de fríjol, papa, arveja y curaba. Actividad que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Debido a la ola invernal que ha afectado la zona en los últimos días, sus cultivos se han visto gravemente afectados, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas que le permitan sacar una cosecha de mejor calidad y minimizar las pérdidas. 
Su mayor sueño es continuar brindando el sustento a su familia y generar los recursos necesarios para la adquisición de una vivienda propia.
texts.en: Jose is 46 years old, and the father of three children who he adores and for whom he works day after day with the goal of providing them with a good education, food, and a home.  Jose grows and harvests peppers, potatoes, peas, and banana passion fruit.  His work has allowed him to bring his family forward and give them a better quality of life.  The recent rainy season has gravely affected his crops.  It is because this that Jose is applying for this loan to buy agricultural supplies that will help him have a better harvest and minimize loses.  Jose's biggest dream is to continue to support his family and to generate the necessary income to buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Alieu

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Alieu. He is married and has five children, aged 23, 22, 18, 14 and 8 years; four are school-going children. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to be fostered.  

In 1988, Alieu established his business selling rice, tomato paste, Maggi, salt, sugar, flour, pure water, soft drink and cigarettes, etc. He began his business when he dropped out of school because of a lack of financial support. He became a shop attendant and worked for a commission for some years. He accumulated the commission and started selling cosmetic items, which has now grown into a shop.  

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,804,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Alieu requires a loan in order to buy rice, salt, sugar and Maggi. In the future, Alieu plans to develop his piece of land, open a bank account for his children, educate his children and open another shop. This loan will improve his business. Inadequate capital is his major challenge.  

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, salt, sugar and Maggi seasoning.

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es: Flor Marina de 42 años,  actualmente cuenta con una tienda la cual abrió para suplir los gastos del hogar. Tiene un hijo de ocho años de edad, por el cual lucha a fin de brindarle el sustento y una educación de calidad. Con el deseo de incrementar las ventas en su negocio, Flor busca abastecer con mayor mercancía su tienda y generar una mayor demanda de sus productos. Por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la materialización de su proyecto. Espera que con dicha inversión pueda mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia y gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Flor Marina, 42, currently has a store that she opened to help with the household expenses.  She has an eight-year-old child, and she strives to support him and give him a quality education.

Flor wants to increase sales in her business, so she's looking to stock her store with more merchandise and generate greater demand for her products.  This is why she's requesting a loan to realize her project.

She hopes she can improve her family's financial stability with this investment and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staple products

loans.name: Ivania Vaneska

texts.es: La joven Ivania, continua con su labor como cajera hace 4 años en un banco, su esposo es docente, así juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos quienes son dos ahora, los que  tiene estudiando en una escuela privada con la ayuda de sus abuelos que le brindan apoyo económico, su deseo para un futuro es poner una tienda en su casa para darles la atención que se merecen sus pequeños. El crédito que solicita Ivania, es para hacer el porche de su casa, para ofrecer mayor comodidad a su familia y que sus hijos puedan disfrutar un poco más cuando juegan, de esta manera va haciéndole estas mejoras que le llena de alegría y agradecimiento porque es un gran avance para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Young Ivania continues with her job of four years as a cashier in a bank.  Her husband is a teacher, and together they get their two children ahead.  They're attending a private school with the help of their grandparents, who help Ivania financially.  Her hope for the future is to set up a store in her house to give her little ones the attention they need.

The loan that Ivania's requesting is for building a porch on her house to give her family greater comfort and so her children can enjoy themselves a little more when they play.

This way she keeps on making these improvements that make her happy and grateful because it furthers her development a lot.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rebar, beams, and cinder blocks

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is a 31-year-old married man, he is a father to two boys. 

Osama has a catering business, where he serves traditional food dishes especially Mansaf. 

He is applying for a loan to buy yoghurt and rice in large amounts to cover the demands of the market.

loans.use: to buy yoghurt and rice

loans.name: Razan

texts.en:
Razan is a 23-year-old single lady, she is the oldest in the family. 

She is a university student who is majoring in the French Language. 

She also works in wedding halls to support her studies.

She is now applying for a loan to pay for some courses she wants to take to support her studies.

loans.use: to pay for some courses

loans.name: Terad

texts.en:
Terad is 21-year-single man. He has four younger siblings. 

Terad is a university student majoring in political sciences. 

He is applying for an educational loan to pay for the rest of his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for the rest of his semester fees.

loans.name: Bona

texts.en:
Bona is 58 years old and married with six children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occdiental. 

She owns and operates a motorcycle transport service in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for over six years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2011 and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and new tires. 

Her hopes and dreams are to improve her standard of living and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and new tires

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 59 years old and married with one child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for over eight years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2011 and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, like noodles, sugar, coffee, shampoo and soap. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like noodles, sugar, coffee, shampoo and soap

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 50 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for over five years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2007 and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, like sugar, coffee, shampoo, soap and noodles. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like sugar, coffee, shampoo, soap and noodles

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José  es una persona de 72 años de edad, esta casado y tiene dos hijos.  su profesión siempre a sido  la carpintería donde prácticamente tiene 55 años de dedicarse a la actividad y  lo aprendió de su padre cuando tenia 18 años de edad y desde entonces, es su principal fuente de ingresos para sacar a su familia a delante.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar algunos materiales que le hacen falta para terminar unos muebles; como espejos, chapas con llaves, pintura y la mano de obra de una persona que le esta apoyando para poder terminar los encargos que le han hecho. Con la inversión, podrá cubrir la necesidad de terminar los muebles con los materiales que comprara para poder vender sus muebles. Teniendo la  oportunidad de mejorar su actividad, que es la carpintería y tendrá a la mano los insumos necesarios para poder realizar su trabajo; ya que es una persona trabajadora y reconocida por su trabajo que realiza donde las personas que lo conocen le compran  la mercadería que él hace.

José  quiere seguir trabajando como carpintero; ya que es una actividad que desde su temprana edad a realizado y le ha permitido sacar a su familia adelante ya que es un trabajo que le gusta y que de tener 55 años de estar realizando la misma actividad que nunca dejara de trabajar de carpintero dice amar a su trabajo y que su meta es seguir trabajando con la fundación ya que le brindo la oportunidad de trabajar cuando él lo necesitaba.
texts.en:
José is 72 years old.  He is married and has two children.  José has always been carpenter, having worked in the trade for some 55 years.  He learned the skills from his father when he was 18 and, since then, it has been his main source of income for hleping his family to prosper.

José is applying for a loan with "Fundación Campo" as he is missing a few materials to finish some pieces of furniture.  He needs mirrors, door handles with locks and paint.  He will also use the loan to pay the labourer who is supporting him in finishing his orders.  With this investment José will be able to cover the costs of finishing the items of furniture and will be able to sell them on.  This loan will give José the opportunity to improve his carpentry work and he will have the materials available to do his work.  José is hard-working and known for his work.  Those who know him buy his products.

José wants to continue working as a carpinter as he has been doing it since he was young.  Through this work he has been able to help his family prosper.  He likes the work and, after 55 years doing it, he says he would never stop doing it.  He loves his work and his goal is to continue working with the communal bank as they have provided him with the opportunity to work when he needed it.

loans.use: to buy some materials that he needs to finish some furniture.  He needs mirrors, door handles with locks, paint and a labourer to finish the orders.

loans.name: Maria Lilian

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer joven, dinámica y muy alegre con 27 años de edad casada que de su matrimonio tiene 3 hijos de los cuales los dos mayores están estudiando en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación los cuales todos dependen de ella en todos los aspectos. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo pero no pudo seguir estudiando por falta de apoyo económico ya que sus padres son de escasos recursos y no pudieron ayudarla. Ella aprendió la actividad de la agricultura gracias a sus padres desde muy joven y hoy en día en compañía de su esposo realizan actividades como limpieza, poda y fertilización ya que este trabajo es el único medio de ingreso para su familia y para cubrir los gastos en el hogar. El terreno que ellos cultivan es propio gracias al esfuerzo impuesto por ambos ubicado a 2 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie diariamente. 

Actualmente Maria Solicita ayuda para la compra de Fertilizantes, Abono y otros insumos para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café ya que mediante a esto ella podrá prevenir que su cultivo se contamine con plagas u otros que dañen el producto.
 
Su sueño es que sus cultivos sean los mas productivos de la zona para poder darle un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos, poder educarlos de una mejor manera a nivel universitario para que en el futuro ellos tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida ya que el trabajo de la tierra es pesado y las ganancias son pocas.
texts.en:
María is a dynamic and happy young woman.  Aged 27, she is married and has three children.   The two oldest are in primary school and all three depend on María for everything.  María herself completed primary school but could not continue with her education as her parents were poor and could not help with the costs.  María learned to work in agriculture very young, thanks to her parents.  She now works with her husband doing work such as cleaning, pruning and putting fertiliser on the plants as this is the only source of income for the family to pay household bills.  María and her husband own the land they work, which is two kilometres from their home.  They walk there every day.

María is currently applying for a loan to buy fertlisers, manure and other materials to maintain her coffee plants as with this she will be able to avoid plagues and other problems that would damage the crops.

María's dream is for her crops to be the most productive in the area, so that she can give her children a better standard of living and educate them up to university level.  Then in the future they will have better opportunities in life as working in the field is difficult and profits are very low.

loans.use: to buy fertlisers and manure for coffee crops.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la agricultura. Él está casado, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 10  y 12 años de edad, no recibe ayudad del extranjero; inicia las actividades agropecuarias  como una fuente de ingresos para su familia.
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y semilla para llevar a cabo la siembra. Este le permitirá tener una mejor cosecha y aumentar los ingresos para darle una mejor estabilidad de vida a su familia.
Su objetivo es remodelar la vivienda  y tener más parcela de tierra para cosechar.
texts.en:
José makes a living in agriculture.  He is married and lives with his wife and two children, aged ten and twelve years old.  José receives no help from other countries. He started working in agriculture in order to have an income for his family.

José needs a loan to invest in buying manure, herbicides, anti-plague treatments, insecticides and seeds for sowing.  This will give him a better harvest and allow him to increase his income and give his family more stability.

José's aim is to remodel the house and to have more land to for growing crops.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, anti-plague treatments, insecticides and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, skirts, pants and other garments to sell.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel is from Panay, Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 28 years old. Miguel is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Miguel owns and operates a transportation service and from this he earns 10,000 PHP per month. He has been doing this work for four years. 

Miguel joined GDMPC in 2007. He is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase spare parts. 

Miguel plans to improve the general living conditions of his family and his business as well.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is 62 years old and married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns and operates a tailoring service in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for over nine years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010 and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional materials for tailoring, such as scissors, needles and threads. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for tailoring, such as scissors, needles and threads

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 44 years old. He is a married man and has four children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. He is the breadwinner of his family. 

He is a teacher getting a low salary, who tries to work hard every day to be able to offer the best to his family. He feels embarrassed when guests come to visit and he does not have furniture for his home. He is requesting the loan, in order to purchase furniture for his house.

His dream is to keep on acquiring the things he lacks, the challenge he faces is fighting any problems that arise.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house.

loans.name: Muath

texts.en:
Muath is now 19 years old. He is a single man, who lives in Ibb, Yemen. 

He has run a small store selling grocery items to the people in his town for 11 years. His customers are mostly his neighbors, who are looking for the affordable prices he offers. 

He started his business with the help of his dad. He would like to earn more profits from his business, which is why he is asking for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy merchandise to sell in his store. He will buy grocery items to sell. 

This will help increase sales capacity and will increase his profits too. 

He hopes to keep offering a good service and affordable prices to his customers. 

He also hopes to expand his business, to get married and to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell in his store.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives in Diani, a beachside town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast and borders Tanzania to the south. 

Inconsistent rainfalls make farming difficult and contribute to the area's high poverty rates. Despite the unreliable rainfall, bees in the region have two excellent sources of food: wild mangrove forest and local passion fruit plantations. Bee-keeping is relatively new to the area, but many farmers are very interested in owning hives. 

Francis is unmarried, and has been farming for three years. He is currently tending to a tree plantation on his land, as well as passion fruit, and is interested in bee-keeping, because the bees will use the nectar from the trees to make their honey, thereby giving him another income stream until his trees mature. He also likes bee-keeping, because it increases the production of passion fruit, boosting yields and the quality of the fruit. 

This is Francis’ first loan and in the future he hopes to establish his own honey business. He plans to use the income generated from his beehives to help pay his college fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Dolores Senaida

texts.es:
Dolores, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el oficio del cultivo de maíz. Este le permitirá pagar el arrendamiento de la tierra, asimismo comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas y semilla para cultivar.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtuvo mejores ingresos. Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado mientras que las condiciones económicas se mantienen.
texts.en:
Dolores is requesting a new loan because she needs to invest more in her corn plantations. She will pay for the land’s rent and will buy compost, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides and seeds.

The previous loan helped her to increase her stock and improve her income. Her family’s conditions have improved and her financial situation is stable.

loans.use: to pay for the land's rent and buy compost, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an appliance for his house.

loans.name: Bensodia Group

texts.fr:
BENSODIA est un groupe de l’association DANAYA de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment alimentaire, de cosmétique et parures à l’image de MARIAM  qui est la deuxième personne assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe  décident d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente des produits de beauté et de parures de femme. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, quelques cartons de crème et pommade pour la peau et des parfums .  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Bensodia Group is part of Dayana Association in Ouelessebougou. It comprises four women who got acquainted through bonds of kinship and neighborhood. They are married and average 30 years of age and three children, and live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou, in Kati prefecture (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They've been in retail for many years, and are very much in demand. They run various businesses, such as buying and selling food condiments, cosmetics, and finery, as Mariam does. She's the second woman from the left in the photograph.

Eager to meet their clientele's increasing needs, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. They are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan).

Mariam, the group's president, is very well-known in Ouelessebougou. She excels in selling cosmetics and women's finery. She intends to use her loan to buy a few boxes of skin creams, pomades, and perfumes.

She gets her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako and where she lives, and retails her products, for cash and on credit, in Ouelessebougou, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She hopes to turn a monthly profit of XOF 15'000 (ca US$ 30) to be used to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Rita Elizabeth

texts.es: Rita, tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Esparta Atlántida. Hace 4 años ella decidió por establecer su propio negocio donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, harina, productos de limpieza y aseo etc. Esta solicitando el tercer préstamo el cual es por 21,000 lempiras y lo va invertir en surtir el negocio con productos alimenticios de consumo diario y una parte en compra de ropa para vender.  Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Rita is 41 years old, married with four children and lives in Esparta Atlántida.  Four years ago she decided to set up her own business selling staple products such as rice, beans, sugar, butter, flour and cleaning and hygiene products.  She is applying for a third loan, worth 21,000 Lempira, that she will use to stock up the store with everyday food products and to buy clothes to sell.  Rita's plan is to expand the business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy staple products to stock up her grocery store.

loans.name: Jose Herbert

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque necesita dinero para mejorar la moto taxi y refrendar el permiso. Este le permitirá  comprar repuestos para este medio de transporte y refrendar la tarjeta de circulación.
El crédito anterior  le ayudo a incrementar la calidad en el servicio y con ello aumento la clientela, las condiciones económicas han mejorado, el grupo familiar se mantiene y se encuentran bien de salud.
texts.en:
José is applying for another loan because he needs money to improve his motorcycle taxi and to extend his taxi license.  This loan will allow him to buy spare parts for his motorbike and to extend the license.

José's previous loan helped him to improve the quality of service he offers and so increase his number of customers.  His financial situation has improved and his family is doing well and is in good health.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle and to extend his taxi license.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, snacks, biscuits and other products.

loans.name: Noela

texts.en: Noela is 40 years old and married with 1 child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, cabbages and cucumber that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Noela needs a loan to purchase more farming tools and chemicals to expand her business. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Noela will use the profits from her sales to save for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, shovels, bush knives to use in growing her crops.

loans.name: Talosaga

texts.en: Talosaga is a 48-year-old single man with no children. He makes and sells cooked noodles and donuts in his community to earn a living. He has 5 years of experience with this business. Talosaga needs a loan to buy more ingredients for use in his food stall. He plans to use the profits to continuing his business to provide for his daily needs. Talosaga has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make noodles and donuts.

loans.name: Manua

texts.en: Manua is a 27-year-old woman who is married with 1 child. She has a small business providing taxi services. To earn extra income, she also repairs cars. Manua needs a loan to buy the parts to repair her taxi. She will use her profits to provide for her family. Manua joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy the parts to repair her taxi.

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en: Kalala is 46 years old and married with 8 children. She makes and sells elei painted lavalava to earn a living and has been doing this for many years. Kalala has requested a loan to buy equipment for her elei. She plans to use her profits to help with her family’s daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy design boards, paint brushes, and fabric.

loans.name: Sio

texts.en: Sio is a 53-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. Sio has requested a loan to buy weed spray, chemicals, knives, spades, axes, and fertilizer as well as pay for her children's school fees. She has been a member of SBPD since 2007. With her profits, Sio hopes to save for her children's school fees and support her family.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, chemicals, knives, spades,axes,and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Maria Olimpia

texts.es:
María, posee una tienda. Ella vive con sus padres y una hija, el oficio lo realiza desde hace un tiempo atrás desde que se construyó una cancha de futbol, sus padres le ayudan con la venta y lo lleva a cabo de las 6:00 am a 7:00 pm.
El crédito que requiere le permitiría surtir la tienda comprando arroz, frijol, maíz, azúcar, sal, entre otros productos para brindarles a los clientes diversidad de mercadería y ellos se sientan satisfechos con la mercancía.
Su sueño es poseer su propia tienda bien establecida.
texts.en:
María has a small store and lives with her parents and daughter.  She started the business some years ago when the soccer field was built.  Her parents help with sales and the store opens from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.

She is in need of a loan to stock her store with rice, beans, corn, sugar and salt, among other products, so she can have on hand a variety of products to offer to customers for their satisfaction.

Her dream is to have a well-established grocery business.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, corn, sugar, salt and other products.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en: This is 38 year-old Alpha. He is married, and has 4 children aged 10, 7, 4 and 1 year, two are going to school. He also has his mother living with him. In 1994, Alpha established a vehicle tire shop. He began his business because he was forced to drop out of school in class 6 because of poverty. He became a truck apprentice learning maintenance and driving. He learnt tire patching also and was later employed in a company doing this. He worked for some years and the salary he accumulated was used to start his own tire business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,248,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Alpha requires a loan in order to buy different sizes of tires needed by his customers. In the future, Alpha plans to educate his children, buy a vehicle, buy machines for his business and build a house. This loan will help to improve his business. He is a committed and hardworking business man. He thanks you for your generosity towards the business people in his country and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different sized used tires for his tire store.

loans.name: Selesitina

texts.en: Selesitina is 49 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling fish, mostly in her community, and has been doing this for many years. Selesitina has requested a loan to buy new fishing gear for her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Selesitina will help with her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy new fishing gear.

loans.name: Veta

texts.en: Veta is a 60-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small cattle farm where she feeds 6 cattle that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Veta needs a loan to purchase wire, posts, knives and chemicals. She has been a member of SBPD since 2008. Veta will use the profits from her sales to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy wire, posts, chemicals, weed spray and knives for her farm.

loans.name: Santos Leonidas

texts.es: Santos, tiene 46 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. Siempre se ha dedicado a la ganadería y agricultura. Hace 4 años se dedica al cultivo de maíz el cual es vendido en el mercado local de la zona. Decidió solicitar un préstamo por 6,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y sembrar dos manzanas de maíz, para ampliar la producción. Su meta es obtener mejores ganancias para tener bienestar personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Santos, 46, is married, has three children and lives in the village of Esparta, Atlántida.  He has always been involved in livestock farming and agriculture.  For four years he has been cultivating corn which he sells at the local market.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,000 HNL to buy fertilizers and sto plant two acres of corn to increase production.  His goal is to increase his profits for personal and family well-being.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to plant two acres of corn.

loans.name: Jose Hector

texts.es: Jose Héctor, tiene 38 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Ilama Santa Bárbara.  El lleva aproximadamente 20 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, actualmente cultiva café, banano y vende plantas de café. La producción la vende en el mercado local.  Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para fertilizar y darle mantenimiento de desagüe y limpieza a su finca de café y banano. Con esta inversión el espera mejor producción y ganancias. Su meta es sembrar otra área de café para incrementar la producción e ingresos y ayudar a su familia con lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Jose Héctor, 38, is married, has five children and lives in the village of Santa Bárbara.  For approximately 20 years he has been involved in agriculture, mainly growing coffee and bananas, and selling coffee plants.  He sells his produce at the local market.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL to buy fertilizer and pay for maintenance of draining and cleaning of his coffee and banana plantations.  With this investment he hopes to improve production and profits.  His goal is to plant more coffee to increase production and income, and give his family what they need.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and hire workers to drain and clean his coffee and banana plantations.

loans.name: Carlos Adolfo

texts.es: Don Carlos, de ocupación comerciante que anhela crecer con su negocio para heredarle a sus nietos un medio seguro de ingresos, junto a su esposa a diario se levanta muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos a la clientela a los que vende por encargo y también en su casa de habitación hoy en día no tienen mucho en su inventario, pero sus planes ahora son invertir en una nueva línea de productos como lo son: abanicos, planchas y perfumes, no sin dejar atras la ropa por el cual solicita el crédito para poder hacer estas compras y vender.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos is a salesman that dreams of expanding his business to leave his grandchildren a stable source of income. He wakes up early in the morning and together with his wife sells his products at home. His customers place orders or buy what he has in stock. 

Carlos does not have enough stock now, so he is planning to invest in a new line of products: fans, irons, perfumes, and of course, clothes. He is requesting a loan to buy these products and sell them.

loans.use: to buy fans, irons, perfumes and clothes.

loans.name: Delia Nohemi

texts.es: Delia, tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una  colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula, su esposo trabaja de taxista. Ella tiene 5 años de tener su propio negocio donde vende agua purificada en botellón, refrescos y venta de ropa usada. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y cuenta con su clientela. Doña delia esta solicitando el quinto ciclo de préstamo el cual es por 6,500 lempiras para surtir de agua, refrescos y ropa para vender. Su plan es ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio y que su esposo logre tener su propio vehículo para taxi.
texts.en: Delia is 51 years old. She  is married and lives with her husband and two children in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula. Her husband works as a taxi driver. She has had her own business for 5 years. She sells purified water by the jug, beverages and used clothing. She has the business in her house and has her customers. Delia is in her fifth loan cycle and the loan she is asking for is for 6,500 lempiras to stock up on water, beverages and clothing to sell. Her plan is to help her children with their education and for her husband to have his own vehicle to use as a taxi.

loans.use: to buy beverages, jugs of water and clothing to sell.

loans.name: La Rosa De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “La Rosa De Guadalupe” es un grupo conformado por 07 socios responsables y trabajadores dedicados a distintas actividades comerciales. Rosario comenzó con el negocio de la venta de abarrotes con los deseos de superación y el buen uso que le dio a sus ingresos, también  habilitó una librería en su vivienda. Nos comenta que se siente feliz con lo que ha logrado. Su siguiente meta es de instalar una mueblería y ver a sus hijos profesionales. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra abarrotes, bebidas y útiles escolares. Rosario de 40 años es casada y tiene 04 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a 02 de ellos.  El grupo “La Rosa De Guadalupe” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Rosario se encuentra en la parte de adelante, es la segunda al medio viste blusa floreada y pantalón negro. Julio no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en: The “La Rosa De Guadalupe” communal bank is made up 0f 7 responsible and hardworking members who work in different commercial activities. Rosario started with the business of selling  groceries and with her wish to get ahead and the good use of her income, she also opened a bookstore in her home. She tells us that she feels happy with what she has been able to do. Her next goal is to open a furniture store and see her children become people with good careers. The loan she has asked for will be used to buy groceries, beverages and school supplies. Rosario is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Right now she is still supporting 2 of them. The “La Rosa De Guadalupe” group is grateful to the people who made this loan possible. Rosario is in front, the second one in the middle. She is wearing a flowered blouse and black pants. Julio was unable to be there because of work.

loans.use: to buy groceries, beverages and school supplies.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento NUEVA VIDA está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis  mujeres y dos  varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Naty tiene 49 años, casada tiene dos  hijos de las edades de 12 y  9 años todos  se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a tejido de mantas, chompas para las mujeres de pollera, tiene su taller en la zona de El Carmen, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Naty va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana por mayor para el tejido de sus mantas y chompas ya que por esta fechas tiene mucha venta también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de el alto, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Naty enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mayor sus materiales para el tejido de sus prendas, la Sra. Naty se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The entrepreneur bank NUEVA VIDA is comprised of eight members, six of whom are women and two men.  The president of the bank is Naty, 49, who is married and has two children, ages 12 and 9, who go to school.  She knits blankets and women's sweaters in her workshop in the area known as El Carmen.  This will be her first loan through the institution and Naty plans to use it to buy wool wholesale to make blankets and sweaters.  This is the time of year she has many orders and also delivers to the city markets in El Alto.

She is requesting a loan to increase her work capital.  Naty must face business challenges such as keeping her business stocked with merchandise.  She will use the profits to continue buying materials wholesale so she can do her knitting work.  Naty is happy and grateful to the institution for the support she is receiving.

loans.use: To buy wool to make sweaters and blankets.

loans.name: Selman Alejandro

texts.es: Selman, es soltero, vive en una aldea del municipio de san Juan Intibucá junto a su madre y su hijo. Lleva más de 6 años de dedicarse a la producción y venta de café. Ofrece al público café en pergamino húmedo y seco.  Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF por 20,000 lempiras el cual lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes y abonos y pago de trabajadores para darle un buen mantenimiento a su finca. El espera obtener una mejor producción este ciclo. Su meta es cultivar más área y darle buena asistencia para mejorar los ingresos y tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Selman is single. He lives in a community in the town of San Juan Intibucá with his mother and son. He has been growing and selling coffee for more than 6 years. He sells wet and dry parchment coffee to the public. He is asking for a second loan from ODEF for 20,000 lempiras. He will use it to buy fertilizers and to pay for workers to do maintenance on his farm. He hopes to get a better yield this cycle. His goal is cultivate a bigger area and really help it to improve his income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and materials and to pay for labor to do maintenance on his coffee farm.

loans.name: Edman

texts.es: Don Edman, tiene 61 años de edad, es casado, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Hace un año estableció su pequeña pulpería donde vende pan, churros, condimentos, champú, productos para limpieza, manteca y otros. Su esposa hace tortillas para vender. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 4,500 Lempiras para comprar azúcar, sal, jabón, arroz y otros para vender en la pulpería. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio para comprar una estufa, arreglar su casa, hacer el piso de cemento y vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Edman, 61, is married and lives in a suburban residential community of San Pedro Sula.  A year ago he set up a grocery store where he sells bread, fritters, condiments, shampoo, cleaning products, shortening and other items.  His wife makes and sells tortillas.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,500 HNL to buy sugar, salt, soap, rice and other items for his grocery.  His goal is to expand the business and buy a stove, as well as renovate the house by putting in a cement floor for better living.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, soap, rice and other grocery items.

loans.name: Sergio Natividad

texts.es: Don Sergio, tiene 61 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, ellos tienen dos hijos y un nieto. Reside en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. El lleva 6 años de dedicarse a su propia actividad de negocio. Presta el servicio de fletes en carreta con caballo, vende verduras, recolecta material para reciclaje y chatarra para vender, y compra y venta de caballos. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 8,500 Lempiras para comprar dos caballos para venderlos a los clientes que le han pedido. Este préstamo le ayudara a capitalizarse y a cumplir con sus pedidos. Su meta es lograr construir su vivienda de material, construir un establo y lograr comprar un vehículo.
texts.en:
Mr. Sergio, 61, lives in a common-law marriage; they have two children and a grandson. He lives in the suburbs of San Pedro Sula. Sergio transports goods using a horse-drawn car, sells vegetables, collects recyclable materials and scrap to sell, and buys and sells horses. He has had this business for six years.

Sergio is requesting a loan of 8,500 Lempiras [HNL] to buy two horses and sell them to two customers that ordered them. This loan will help him to bring together some money and fulfill his orders. His goals are to build his house with solid material, build a stable and buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy two horses and sell them.

loans.name: Asoleaga

texts.en: Asoleaga is a 48-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Asoleaga has requested a loan to buy knapsack spray, a wheel barrow, chemicals and knives etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Asoleaga hopes to extend her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy knapsack spray, wheel barrow, chemicals and knives

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina is 40 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling donuts, pancakes etc in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy goods to start her canteen. In the future, Selina hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: flour, cooking oil, large cooking pot and sugar.

loans.name: Leotina

texts.en: Leotina is a 23-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells fresh fish in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. Leotina needs a loan to buy new tools and equipment for her business. She plans to use her profits to help her family and provide her children with education. Leotina has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: canoe, pears and fishing gear.

loans.name: Tirupati Swamy Group

texts.en:
This group is called “Tirupati Swami” and was formed in the year 2009. Its six members are all women from a town called Muniguda. It is located in the district of Rayagada; one of the poorest districts in India. 

One of the members of this group is Jasobanti. The one standing extreme left with raised hand in the photo is Jasobanti. She is a 37-year-old married lady, living with her husband, one daughter aged 17, and one son aged 15 who are continuing their studies. Jasobanti herself has been running a fancy-item store in Muniguda for the last two years.  Her husband has also been running a fancy-item vending business for the last 12 years. He moves four days in a week to the local weekly markets to sell his fancy items. 

Jasobanti sells items like bangles, talc, nail polish, clips, combs, mirrors, face cream, ribbons, etc. She says there is a lot of demand as it is a huge market with almost 40 villages depending on this market and that she does not have enough stock to meet the demand. She does not like saying “No” to her customers and wants to be able to give the best service to her customers. She now wants to buy more stock of what she is selling like bangles, talc, nail polish, clips, combs, mirrors, face cream, ribbons, etc. to increase her inventory level to be able to meet the demand and seize the business opportunity. 

Over the period of four years Jasobanti has been able to add some assets like a TV and a bed and do some house repairs from her income. The present loan amount will be utilized by her to purchase increased stock in bulk which will reduce her buying costs. She hopes to save enough from her increased revenues for her daughter's wedding and construction of a house for her family.

The other five members of her group are Gurubari, Budu, Laxmi, Tunu and Tulasi with fish selling, fancy-item vending, fish selling, Tiffin centre (tearoom), leaf plate making & sweet making businesses.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing bangles, talc, nail polish, clips, combs, mirrors, face cream, ribbons, etc.

loans.name: Trinath Group

texts.en:
Trinath is a Joint Liability Group formed in the year 2010 by six active women entrepreneurs of Titilagarh town of Bolangir district in Odisha, India to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their existing business. Sabitri is one of them. The lady standing in front in the photograph is Sabitri. She is a very active lady of 50 years,and she lives with her husband and two sons of 25 and 22. Her elder son has already completed computer hardwire engineering with a multimedia course. She has also three daughters who have already got married and live in their in-laws' houses. 

Sabitri is running a multifarious business of computer and mobile service, photo studio, photocopy and cold drinks center with the help of her husband and two sons. Sabitri and her husband look after the cold drinks center which has been in existence for 20 years,  and her sons manage the computer, mobile phone and photocopy center. 

This is the second loan of Sabitri from Mahashakti Foundation. From the first loan she purchased a refrigerator for her cold drinks center. Looking into the present market demand, Sabitri wants to purchase cold drinks in bulk from the present loan to save unnecessary transport cost and frequent re-stocking of cold drinks. Sabitri says that out of the income from the present businesses she paid for her three daughters' marriages in a befitting manner and was able to send her son for completing his engineering degree in Hardwire. Considering the professional degree of her elder son, Sabitri hopes to open a photo lab and complete the marriage preparations of her two sons in an appropriate manner. 

The other five members of the group are Puspanjali, Jyotsna, Gayatri, Sabitri-B and Bhagya who are running businesses like betel nut shop, tea stall, Tiffin stall, electrical repair shop and another Tiffin stall respectively.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing cold drinks

loans.name: Jaya Durga Group

texts.en:
Jaya Durga Joint Liability Group was formed in the year 2011 by four active women of Titilagarh town of Bolangir district in Odisha, India to access loans from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their business. Shridebi, aged about 36 years, is one of them. The lady standing extreme right in the photo, raising her hand, is Shridebi. She lives with her husband and two daughters aged 14 and 4 years old. Both her children are continuing their studies in the local school.

Shridebi has been running a fish trading business for last 10 years with the help of her husband. Her husband usually purchases 1 ton of fish daily from a distant place, 800 kms away, i.e., Andhra Pradesh, by train. Shridebi supplies it to 30 customers of the town and nearby villages. She gets a profit margin of 5 INR per 1 kg of fish. In this way she gets a monthly profit of 8,000 INR. Out of this income she has been able to contribute some part for household expenses like the educational expenses of her children. 

Shridebi wants to increase the volume of her business from this loan amount by purchasing more fish to supply. This will help her to get some extra income. Shridebi dreams of providing better education to her children as she believes that education is the pillar of success and also of constructing a good house for residential purposes. 

The other three members of the group are Mohini, K.Jamuna and Kishori with a TV cable business, tailoring and gold smith and bike repairing garage respectively.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fish

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda is a woman of 35 years old who is married with five children. She runs a small brick business to earn a living. She has four years experience with this business. 

Amanda needs a loan to buy new tools and equipment like cement, a wheelbarrow, sand, spade, etc. needed for the production of bricks. She will use her profits to buy herself a new truck for delivery in the near future. Amanda joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cement, a wheelbarrow, sand and a spade, etc

loans.name: Liarown

texts.en: Liarown is 23 years old and single with no children. She wants to start a small business making and selling barbecue in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy all the ingredient for her barbecue. In the future, Liarown hopes to continue with her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cartons of chicken, soy sauce, onions, salt, and sausages

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy, a 38-year-old married mother of six, has a small garden where, for the past two years, she has been growing taro, yam, banana and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. A member of SBPD since March of this year, Daisy is requesting a loan to buy bush knives, chemicals, fertilizer, a weed sprayer and a wheelbarrow. She will use the profits from her sales to pay her children's school fees and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, chemicals, fertilizer, a weed sprayer and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a frying pan, flour, sugar, vegetable oil and baking soda.

loans.name: Pisa

texts.en: Pisa is a 49-year-old married woman with five children. She would like to start growing taro, bananas and taamu to earn a living. Pisa has requested a loan to buy some of the equipment and tools she needs to run her business. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Pisa will spend her profits to support her family and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives, chainsaw, weed sprayer and chemicals.

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela is 28 years old and married with three children. She has a small plantation where she grows taamu, yams, bananas and taro, which she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Rasela needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizers, bush knives, a weed sprayer and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SBPD since March 2013. 

Rasela will use the profits from her sales to extend her business and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizers, bush knives, a weed sprayer and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Anarosa

texts.en:
Anarosa is 24 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling snacks, cooked noodles, donuts, etc. in her community. 

To do this, she needs a loan to buy all the goods and ingredients. 

In the future, Anarosa hopes to expand her food production sales. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy snacks, donuts, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Vevesi

texts.en:
Vevesi is 21 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling fish, octopus and sea cucumbers in her community. She has been doing this for more than two years.

Vevesi has requested a loan to buy a fishing boat, spears and fishing net. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. 

Vevesi will use her earnings not only to improve her business but to also support her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat, spears and fishing net.

loans.name: Tuusao

texts.en:
Tuusao is 66 years old and married with 9 children. She has a cattle farm and a small plantation where she grows taro, bananas, yams, and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years.

Tuusao needs a loan to buy chemicals, weed spray, a chainsaw, knives, and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed spray, a chainsaw, and knives for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 34 years old and married with two children. She lives in Jiminez, Misamis Occidental. For the past four years, Delia has been a farmer who plants and harvests papaya to sell in the local community. She earns 3,000 PHP every month. Delia joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Delia is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Sesili

texts.en:
Sesili is a 59-year-old married woman with six children. For over ten years, she has operated a huge plantation where she grows taro, yams, banana, and taamu to sell in her community. Sesili has been a member of SPBD since 2009.
 
Sesili is requesting a loan to buy new equipment such as a wheelbarrow, crowbar, spade, knives, rakes, and other tools for her farm. She plans to use the profits from her loan to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, crowbar, spade, knives, rakes, and other tools

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
Jhona is 30 years old and married with two children. She lives in Jiminez, Misamis Occidental. For the past three years, Jhona has owned and operated a motorcycle transport service. She earns 10,000 PHP every month and joined GDMPC in 2011.
