Norma is a married woman and the mother of three children. She lives in the city of Cartagena, a place where she has worked as a merchant for many years. At a young age, she began selling merchandise to her friends and now she distributes products to other departments within Colombia because her clientele has grown. Nine years ago, Norma joined Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that has helped her to grow. She currently handles direct sales by herself, but over time she would like to have a team of salespeople in different neighborhoods of the city and in other departments. Her goals going forward are to finish the renovations to her house and to become the best salesperson of her products on a national level.

Norma is now applying for her first Kiva loan so that she can purchase a large volume of products through a promotion. This will increase her sales and generate more profits, thus turning her Kiva loan into a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy a large volume of cosmetics through a promotion.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Maria de 54 años de edad se dedica a la elaboracion de tamales desde hace 19 años en su lugar de residencia, es una mujer responsable en su hogar y trabajadora, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, ella esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar todo lo necesario para la elaboracion de sus tamales como hoja de huerta que sirve para embolverlos asi como sale en la fotografia, vegetales, pollo, maiz entre otras cosas y asi seguir vendiendolos ya que tiene mucha clientela, y poder tener mejores ganancias para solventar los gastos de su hogar y seguirle dando lo mejor a su familia con la ayuda de su esposo.
texts.en:
Doña Maria, 54 years old, has been making tamales for 19 years in her place of residence.  She is a woman who is responsible in her home and hardworking. She lives in her own house with her husband and children.

She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase all she needs to make tamales, such as banana leaves used to wrap them, as seen in the photograph, vegetables, chicken, and corn among other things, and continue selling them because she has many customers. Thus, she will be able to earn more to pay for household expenses and continue, with her husband’s help, to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to purchase products (corn, vegetables, chicken, etc) to make tamales.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a single mother of four children and only three of her children go to school.  She has a pub and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer and sodas and jerrycans of local gin.  She generates additional income from selling charcoal.  

Teopista works from her home and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis only, seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters.  She is aspiring of owning a fully-stocked pub and also of becoming a wholesaler of beer. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO to improve on  her standard of living. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for electricity and schoolfees .

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and sodas and jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Abeishemwe Tukore Group

texts.en: Ignitius is a married man with two children, in addition to taking care of his two sisters. Ignitius sells fruits like pineapples, pawpaws, oranges and watermelons to earn a living. He sells these on a busy street on the city outskirts. He works 13 hours each day, all the days of the week, in order to break even. His main challenges are fluctuation in prices as well as poor transport which affects the perishable fruits. He hopes to venture into poultry to supplement his strained income. The client will use this loan as a top up to acquire a small piece of land neighboring him. This will increase the piece of land on which he grows the fruits. He is a hard-working man. The group supports each other to foster community development. The second person from the left to right at the back is the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To complete payment on a piece of land

loans.name: Vilgister

texts.en:
Vilgister is a 48-year-old lady from Migori. She is married to Michael, and they have four children aged 24, 18, 12 and 6 years old respectively.

Vilgister is a dairy farmer, a business she has done for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES. 9,500. She has now borrowed her sixth loan of KES. 60,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase another dairy cow. 

The profits she earns will be used to buy dairy feeds and repay her loan. Her dream is to run a successful dairy business and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nhat

texts.en:
Nhat was born in 1957. She has two children who have their own families. Nhat has wisdom. She raises chickens and grows rice to earn a living. Her income is about 2,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 30 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 2,000,000 VND per month. 

Nhat has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2006. In the last cycle, she borrowed 2,834,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 3,706,000 VND to buy food for her chickens. She wants to use her profit to buy more baby chickens to raise.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is taking out another Kiva loan to expand her existing business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase new spare parts to repair her sewing machine and purchase sewing threads and cloth materials. Lilian is grateful of the opportunity given by Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva lenders to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase new spare parts to repair her sewing machine and purchase sewing threads and cloth materials.

loans.name: Mirna Maribel

texts.es:
Mirna tiene 32 años de edad. Ella cuenta con cinco años de experiencia en la venta de frutas, las que vende en el mercado municipal y un año de administrar su propia tienda. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar frutas, productos para vender en la tienda y para pagar una deuda que posee con otra institución.  Con la inversión podrá comprar todo lo que necesita para sus negocios y salir de esa deuda que paga muchos intereses. Su propósito, es trabajar muy fuerte para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mirna is 32 years old. She has five years of experience with selling fruits. Mirna sells these products at the municipal market, but she has also been managing her own store for the past year.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy fruits and products to sell in her store. She will also pay off a debt that she has with another institution. With this investment, Mirna can buy everything she needs for her businesses and cancel a debt that is charging high interest. She intends to work very hard so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits, merchandise for her store, and to pay off a debt with another institution.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Jose Moises

texts.es: Don Jose de 32 años de edad se dedica a la siembra de maiz y frijol desde hace 10 años las siembras que recoge las va almacenando en los graneros que estan detras de él en la foto, para luego salirlos a comercializar y con las ventas que hace logra sacar una buena ganancia que le ayuda con los gastos que tiene en su hogar, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos de 13, 10, 9, 6, 4 años todos estudian actualmente, el solicta un credito que le ayude a comprar mas insumos agricolas como fertilizantes, abonos, semillas y otras cosas que le ayudaran a tener una mejor cosecha, para obtener mejores ganancias y asi seguirle dando a su familia lo necesario sin tener alguna limitacion.
texts.en:
Jose is 32 years old. For the past ten years he has earned a living cultivating corn and beans. He stores his harvests in the granaries that are behind him in the photo. The harvests are later removed for sale. The good profit he has been able to make from the sales help cover his household expenses. 

He lives with his wife and their 5 children aged 13, 10, 9, 6, and 4. All of his children are currently studying.

He is requesting a loan to help buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers, compost, seeds and other things that will improve his harvest. This way he will make a higher profit and be able to continue providing his family with all of their necessities without limit.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies (compost, fertilizers, etc.).

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras; está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza el cual les permite saber la situación económica de cada una, donde casi todas las integrantes ya lograron superar la línea de pobreza; a través de las Capacitaciones del Plan de Negocios y Técnica en Ventas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Luisa quien en su última encuesta mostró estar en un nivel medio. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que tiene una despensa mas solida luego de contar con los créditos de la Fundación Paraguaya, también se debe destacar el trabajo que ella hace, ya que se esfuerza siempre al máximo por crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Solicita este crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, fideo, aceite, leche, bebidas en general; entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras group is in its ninth loan cycle in the program of the women's committee, in which they all work and help each other mutually to get ahead.  They're doing the poverty-elimination survey, which allows them to determine each one's economic situation.  Almost all the members already managed to get above the poverty line through the business plan and sales techniques trainings.

One of the members is Luisa, who came out at the middle level in her last survey.  She says that, because of all her work, she has a stronger store after having the loans from Fundación Paraguaya.  The work she does should also be highlighted because she always makes the maximum effort to grow and get ahead.

She's requesting this loan to buy flour, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, beverages, and other things.  This will help her firm up her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, beverages, etc.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Blas está en su ciclo número 14. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual les permitirá saber cómo están sus ingresos. 4 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir, tienen muy bajos ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lourdes, quien en su encuesta mostró estar en un nivel medio. Ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, ya que siempre hace muy buenas comidas. Lourdes comenta que quiere seguir trabajando y esforzándose para poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan y también para mejorar su economía.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de carne, condimentos, verduras, huevo, harina y demás, para poder seguir haciendo los comestibles que vende, y también para poder seguir haciendo las delicias para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 'San Blas' group are on their fourteenth loan cycle. They all completed the poverty stoplight survey which lets them rate their incomes.  Four of the group's members live below the poverty line which means they have very low income.

One of the members of this group is Lourdes who, when she completed the survey, was shown to be at an intermediate level.  She says that her business is selling all kinds of food.  She has gained a very good customer base as she always prepares very good food.  Lourdes comments that she would like to continue working hard so that she can provide her family with what they need and improve their financial situation.

Lourdes is requesting this loan to invest in buying meat, condiments, vegetables, eggs, flour, etc. so that she can continue preparing the food that she sells and continue pleasing her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, eggs, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil. Empezó vendiendo a sus amigos los articulos de hogar, luego comenzó a vender en el mercado y pudo capitalizarse y comprar los artículos para el lugar le gusta su trabajo. Trabaja sola de 9h00 a 20h00.

Vende artículos de hogar como tostadoras las comprar a $15 y las vende a $24, batidoras las comprar a las $16 y las vende a $25, ollas las comprar a $22 y las vende a $35. Su enfermedad no le permite trabajar  normalmente en negocio ya que ella es pvvs (paciente viviendo con vih sida). No es casada, tiene un hijo de 1 año. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar articulos de hogar como batidoras, licuadoras, electrodomesticos para asi tener mas ingresos con las ventas. Su sueño es poder expandir y tener una red de vendedores compartir junto a su familia y darles una vida digna
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil. She began selling household goods to her friends, but later on she began selling at the market. This enabled her to build up capital so that she could buy merchandise. She enjoys her job and works alone from 9:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M.

The borrower sells household goods. These include toasters that she buys for $15 and sells for $24, mixers that she buys for $16 and sells for $25, and cookware that she buys for $22 and sells for $35. Her illness does not allow her to work at her business on a normal basis. She is a patient who is living with HIV/AIDS. The borrower is not married and has a one-year-old child.

With this loan, she wants to buy household goods such as mixers, blenders, and other electric appliances so that she can generate more profit from her sales. Her dreams include expanding and building a network of salespeople, spending time with her family, and providing them with a decent life.

loans.use: to buy mixers, blenders, and other appliances.

loans.name: Kokuere Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kokuere está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza,  el cual es un medio que les ayuda a saber en qué situación económica están las miembros del grupo.
Soraida es una de las integrantes de este grupo, quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles en general, ella misma dice que es muy buena con lo que hace, ya que tiene muy buena clientela, y con ello siempre agota todo lo que hace. Su sueño es poder tener un negocio fijo de comestibles en el que podrá vender sus comidas.
Solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para hacer los comestibles que vende, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, panificados y demás. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que ha recibido.
texts.en: The Kokuere group is in its first cycle of the women's communal bank programme.  They are currently carrying out a survey aimed at eliminating poverty, as this is a way of helping them find out the financial situation of the members.  Soraida, one of the group's members, makes and sells food items and believes that she is successful in what she does because she has a very large clientele and because, with the group's help, she always sells everything she makes.  Her dream is to have a permanent grocery shop where she can sell her food.  She is seeking this loan to buy supplies to make the items of food she sells, namely vegetables, meat, condiments, bread and cakes, amongst other things.  She is very grateful for the chance she has been given.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, bread and cakes, amongst other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory for his used auto parts business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a 38 year old married woman living in Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business for more than three years now together with her husband. This is their main source of income. Delia works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of their family. She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Delia hopes to make their business a success and more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children. The oldest is 25 years old and the youngest is 2 months old. She is engaged in the fishing business. She has been in this business for 25 years now. This is the source of her income. Elizabeth is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets, hooks, floaters, and lead sinkers. These materials will improve her business by helping her to get a better catch. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks, floaters, and lead sinkers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. 

Mary has operated a water vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to have a large amount of water storage in the near future.

With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase a water tank for storing water for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to Clean, Prune and Transplant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to Clean and Prune

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To clean and set up nursery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a metallic structure.

loans.name: Unidas Por Siempre 27 Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento UNIDAS POR SIEMPRE 27 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  el presidente del banco es el Sr. Edgar tiene 48 años, dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada en su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicado en la populosa feria 16 de julio,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Edgar va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa chamarras por mayor para esta época de frio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de mercadería,  el Sr. Edgar enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las condiciones climáticas y también la competencia  de los demás negocios de venta de ropa y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de variedad de ropa   y también en la ampliación de su negocio para poder captar más clientes el Sr. Edgar es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
The business venture bank ALWAYS UNITED 27 is made up of eight members: six women and two men. The president of the bank is Edgar. He is 48 years old and has two children. 

Edgar earns a living selling seasonal clothing from his stall located in a busy market called 16th of July. 

This is his first loan with this institution. Edgar will use the loan to buy coats wholesale for sale during the cold season. He is requesting the loan because he does not have the cash to buy the merchandise. Edgar faces challenges in his business, such as the climatic conditions as well as the competition of the other businesses that sell clothes. He will use his earnings to purchase a variety of clothes and also to expand his business to be able to attract more clients. 

Edgar is a very hard-working individual. He is happy to have the opportunity to have this loan.

loans.use: to buy coats wholesale

loans.name: Karrar

texts.en:
Karrar is a 27-year-old youth client from Iraq. He is married and a father of 2 children. He works hard to provide for his family by working in his small shop where he manufactures aluminum doors and windows. Karrar has been running his own business since 2007; he gained his experience through previously working at similar shops as an employee for several years. Now, Karrar has his own workplace and his own employee, and has gained the respect of his neighborhood thanks to his competitive prices and professionalism. 

Karrar is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to buy a modern machine used for cutting aluminum. With this loan, Karrar will be able to increase his production which will grow his business and increase his profits. With the increase in his revenues, Karrar will be able to provide all the needed funds to cover his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a modern machine used for cutting aluminum

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Cecilia. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan which she used to buy more load cards and cellphone accessories. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her family’s personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 9,000 PHP loan so she can buy extreme load cards and cell phone accessories like batteries, housings and chargers. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cecilia hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more extreme load cards and cell phone accessories like batteries, housings and chargers.

loans.name: Abdulhadi

texts.en: Abdulhadi is a very hard-working person who is always looking to provide a better life for his family. He is 25 years old and a father of three children who live together in Taiz, Yemen. He is a bus driver that is focused on earning more money. He hopes in this way to support his children with a better standard of living. Eager to get his business going, he is hoping for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for repairing his bus. As well, he hopes that with his earnings he can provide his family with a better quality of life and a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairing his bus.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married and has been blessed with three school-going children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Sarah operates a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation to her place of business. Sarah dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future. With her KES 30,000 loan she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruit for resale

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan, twenty, is from Iraq. He is single and lives with three other family members; three of them are employed.

Hasan owns a small metal shop where he manufactures water gallons. He established his business in 2010 and has gained much experience in this field. He now has an employee and an excellent reputation in the neighborhood.

Hasan is requesting a youth loan of 1,800 USD through CHF to buy specialized equipment for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may take better care of his parents and start saving for his future.

loans.use: to buy specialized equipment for his work.

loans.name: Teryline

texts.en:
Teryline is a married woman who has three, school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are neighbours and college students. She faces a challenge of seasonality, especially during holiday seasons when schools have closed. At those times, she experiences a low number of turnouts. With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase supplies for manicures, pedicures, and facials, plus relaxing chemicals, shampoo and hair conditioner. She decided to join Yehu because of favorable loaning requirements.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for manicures, pedicures, and facials, plus hair care products

loans.name: Bayartogtokh

texts.en:
Mr. Bayartogtokh is a married man, who lives with his daughter and wife at Darkhan city. His daughter attends high school, while his wife works in a local water center. 

Bayartogtokh supports his family by operating a transportation business, with a minivan. He runs for local transportation through Darkhan city for most of the year, and during the summer time he contracts with a tourist company and runs for tourists. Before this summer's contract he wants to make some renovation and repair to his minivan. Thus, he is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT  loan, which he will use to change the wheels and the interior section of his minivan, in order to make it more comfortable for tourists.

loans.use: to make some repair work for his minivan before tourist season

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 36 years old and a single woman. She lives at Ugac Sur. She runs a store and sells groceries and other items, for a living. She has been in her business for over 10 years. She usually earns PHP 20,000 each month in her business. She uses her income for meals, bills at home, and revolving capital for use in the business.

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 40,000. She will use it to buy more items to sell in her store, like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, soap and shampoo. The purchase of inventory will help increase her sales capacity, and income as well. 

Cecilia hopes to keep improving her small business, to attain financial independence someday. Further, she hopes to keep growing as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, soap and shampoo

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Baigalmaa is 32 years old and lives with her husband and three sons. They have a ger (traditional, portable, felt dwelling) in Hovd province of western Mongolia. Her husband, Tsogoo, works as a security guard in a local company. He has started an organic vegetable-growing business on their plot of land. Her son, Anhbayar, age 6, just enrolled in primary school, and her twin boys, Byambadorj and Byamba-Ochir, age 2, go to kindergarten. Baigalmaa has been running a clothing sales business, at a rental counter of a local market, since 2009.

She is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT. She will use the loan to purchase seeds and soils, to prepare for their cultivation of organic vegetables on their plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and soils, to prepare for their cultivation of organic vegetables on their plot of land

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a 52-year-old man. He is a father of seven children, living in Taiz, Yemen. He is a bus driver. It has been a profitable business and the only source of income for the family.

He is requesting a loan from AMB, to help him cover the cost of purchasing new spare parts for the bus he drives. This will increase the bus's capacity to work extra hours and will enable him to take additional requests, which will improve the family's income.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing new spare parts for the bus he drives.

loans.name: Dyrle

texts.en:
This is Dyrle. She previously took a 30,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase a greater quantity and variety of grocery items, toiletries and beverages, for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of 50,000 PHP. She will use it to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products, to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Dyrle dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have her own family someday. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to resell at her store, for example, groceries, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Consolette

texts.en:
Consolette is 47 years old. She is married and has five children, aged between 12 and 20. All of her children attend schools. She has been a maize farmer for the past 20 years. Her husband is a house builder. Consolette has requested a Kiva loan, with which she will buy fertilizers for use in the cultivation of maize, to get a heavy output [yield]. With the profits from the business, she will build a house. In the picture, she displays her previous maize yield.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for use in the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
Timoteo is a 42-year-old, married man and father of six children, from Talibon, Bohol. He has been engaged in the motorcycle transport and hog-raising businesses for more than 19 years. 

He is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise and fuel for the motorcycle. With this, Timoteo will be able to improve his ventures, thus augmenting his income and profit. He has hopes of making his business a success and sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and fuel for the motorcycle

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarsaikhan, 47 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling), on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi services to local people for eleven consecutive years and accumulated a vast amount of experience. His wife purchases fruits from an outdoor market at wholesale prices, and sells them to local people at retail prices.

Even though the ger they live in has been insulated and renovated, the family is not sure whether it can shelter them properly from strong storms and frosts, during harsh winter times. So Bayarsaikhan decided to build a house, which will have vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, hard steel roofing and brick walls. In order to build his dream house, he is requesting a loan of 6,900,000 MNT. He will use this amount to purchase building and insulation materials, such as planks, bricks, iron, fiberglass, foam and gypsum. Using those materials, he can build his own house, which will enable the family to live in a comfortable and warm place during harsh winter times. More importantly, this dream house will contribute to the efforts against air pollution, because the family will burn less coal and emit less smoke. The borrower, one of our reliable clients, used his previous loan for ger insulation as expected, and he paid each installment at the scheduled time, without delay.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials, such as fiberglass, planks, and bricks

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 36 years-old. He is married with four children aged between 8 and 16. All of his children attend schools. He has been a maize farmer for the past 15 years. His wife works with him in the maize plantation. 

Pascal is requesting a Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizers to use in the maize production to increase output. With the profits from the business, he will buy cows to provide milk to the family.He shows his previous maize yields in the photo.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to use in maize production.

loans.name: Los Unicos Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento LOS UNICOS está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es La Sra. Neidy  tiene 34 años y tiene  cinco hijos que tienen las  edades de 15, 13, 5, 2  y 9 años, que se encuentra en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de variedad de repostería en panadería, ella tiene su tienda  que se encuentra en la zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Neidy  va a usar este préstamo  para la  para la elaboración de galletas, empanadas y tortas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo, La Sra. Neidy  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia que existe en la zona como también la  de mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para incrementar su producción, se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: The "Los Unicos" communal bank is comprised of eight members, six women and two men. The president of the bank is Neidy, who's 34 years old. She has five children who are 15, 13, 5, 2 and 9 years old, and some of them are of school age. She makes and sells various types of pastries in a bakery. She owns a store located in the San Pedro area of the town of Santa Cruz. This is her first loan with the institution. Neidy will use this loan to bake cookies, empanadas and pies. The reason why she requests this loan is the lack of working capital. Neidy faces challenges in her business such as the local competition, and also the need to improve her living conditions. She'll use the profits to increase her production. She feels glad to have been given the opportunity to receive this loan, since this business is her only means of livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as flour, sugar and leavening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Elizephan

texts.en:
Elizephan is 42 years-old.  He is married with four children aged between seven and fifteen. All of his children attend schools. He has been a maize farmer for the past five years. His wife also works as a farmer. He has requested a Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizers to use in maize production which will increase output. With the profits from the business, he will reinvest in the farming of maize. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is 51 years-old. He lives in Ninotsminda District with his 49 year-old wife and 23 year-old son. Suren has requested loans from local financial institutions several times in order to start-up a family business but without any success. His loan requests have always been rejected because of his low income and the family's poor living conditions.

The main source of income for the family is from agriculture and they have a plot of land where potatoes are grown. They also have pigs. Pigs are sold as a meat with the harvested potatoes at local markets.

Suren requested a loan from Kiva partner Credo in order to start a family business.  His loan request was approved through a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor who do not have access to credit products and are regarded as high risk borrowers due to low income. 

With the loan Suren will purchase a car. He will drive it as a taxi to transport villagers. With the new business Suren will be able to earn additional daily income and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a car and drive it as a taxi.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 55 years-old and married with three children. He is selling balut (a fertilized duck egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten) and mineral water in their village. He is very patient in order to to gain income from his business. His wife is a government employee and wanted to supplement their income though his small business.  

At present, he wants to increase his sales but he has insufficient funds.  Therefore, he is asking for a loan of P7,000 in order to buy more balut and bottled mineral water to sell. 

Aside from gaining more sales, he hopes to keep offering good products and services to all his customers.

loans.use: to buy more balut and bottled mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Yunus

texts.ru: Юнус доброжелательный и умелый мужчина в возрасте 42 лет. Он имеет позитивные принципы в жизни, относиться к людям хорошо и всегда готов помогать тем, кому нужна помощь. Он многое дома делает своими руками, а также учит этому своих сыновей и их друзей. Юнус женат и  имеет троих детей, двое из них сыновья и одна прекрасная дочка.Его жена - домохозяйка, она занимается домашними хлопотами и растит детей вместе со своим мужем. Юнус  работает мастером по ремонту автомашин, и у него есть своя собственная мастерская, где он осуществляет данный бизнес. Но бизнес, которым он занимается, приносит ему доход на ежедневные семейные расходы, часть из них тратится на нужды детей. В скором времени его старший сын собирается жениться. Это большая радость для родителей, но организовать такое большое и важное мероприятие стоит большого труда и расходов. Для этого необходимо подготовить достойное жильё для молодожёнов. Поэтому сейчас Юнусу необходимы денежные средства для того, чтобы сделать капитальный ремонт в своём доме, где и будут жить молодые после свадьбы, а также для проведения свадебного мероприятия. Столкнувшись с этой ситуацией, Юнус обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит для осуществления своих целей, так как имея существующий доход от своего бизнеса, накопить необходимую сумму потребуется очень много времени. Юнус надеется на положительное решение со стороны Арванд и заранее благодарит.
texts.en: Yunus is a friendly and skillful person, 42 years of age. He has a positive outlook in life, treats people well and is always ready to help out those in need. He does a lot of house repairs on his own and teaches these skills to his sons and their friends. Yunus is married and has three children: two sons and a beautiful daughter. His wife is a homemaker; she takes care of the household and, along with her husband, raises their children. Yunus works as a car mechanic and he has his own repair shop in which he works. This business brings in enough income for everyday household needs, including the needs of his children. Soon his eldest son is about to get married. Such an event is a big joy for the parents, but requires a lot of work and expense. This is why Yunus needs funds in order to do  major repairs his house, where the newlyweds will live after the wedding, and also to pay for the wedding reception. Facing this challenge, Yunus turned to Arvand for a loan to realize his goals, since relying just on the income from his business, he would need a very long time to save enough funds. Yunus is hoping for a positive decision by Arvand and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza, de 43 años de edad , esta casada y tiene dos hijos de 20 y 14 años quienes aun dependen de ella para su educación y su alimentación, ella vive en su casa propia junto su familia. Esperanza tiene una salon de belleza en donde hace peinados,cortes de cabello, arreglo de las uñas, entre otros servicios .Lleva haciendo este trabajo por 9 años y lo hace sola ya que la otra mitad del local lo emplea su hermana para otro negocio.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene libertad en cuanto al tiempo que emplea en su faena, tiene clientes antiguos que saben que hace un buen trabajo y por lo tanto vuelven cada cierto tiempo para que les haga un cambio de look, espera mas adelante implementar con mas accesorios y hacer otro tipo de trabajos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy emocionada y agradecida por el respaldo económico que le ofrecen para continuar con sus planes.Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales y accesorios como tijeras , esmaltes de diferentes colores, ganchos . gorros de peluquería y otros detalles para que así pueda continuar brindando un buen servicio a sus fieles clientes.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 43 years old, married, and has two children who are 14 and 20 who depend on her for their education and food.  She lives in her own house with her family.  

Esperanza has a beauty salon where she does hairstyles, haircuts, manicures, and other services.  She has been doing this work for 9 years.  She works alone since the other half of the store is used for another business by her sister.  The thing she likes about her work is that she has the freedom to decide what time to spend at work.  She has long-time customers who know that she does good work, so they come back every so often for her to give them a new look.  She hopes that soon she can use more accessories and do other types of work. 

Currently she is requesting 1,000 soles.  She is very excited and grateful for the financial support being offered to continue with her plans.  With the money requested, she will purchase supplies and accessories such as scissors, different colored nail polish, hairpins, hair caps, and other details so that she can continue providing good service to her loyal customers.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as scissors, nail polish, hairpins, and others.

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es: El joven Manuel, de 22 años de edad labora como contador, el empezó a trabajar desde los 18 lo que le ha permitido obtener experiencia laboral, actualmente está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería en computación y con su salario paga sus estudios, pero ya se aproxima el curso de titulación al que tiene que ingresar para poder obtener su título profesional y sus ingresos no le ayudan para cubrir este gasto de un solo pago, es por eso que Manuel solicita el apoyo de crédito para tal fin y así podría aplicar para un mejor empleo y ayudar a su familia, agradece a Kiva y Afodenic por hacer posible su sueño de terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en: Young Manuel is 22 years old and works as an accountant. He started working at the age of 18, which has allowed him to accumulate work experience. He's currently studying for a career in computer engineering and uses his salary to pay for his studies. However, the time to validate his diploma is approaching, and he has to pay for that in order to obtain his professional degree. His earnings are not enough to cover these costs all at once, and that's why Manuel request the help of a loan for this purpose. That way he could apply for a better job and support his family. He gives thanks to Kiva and Afodenic for making it possible for him to achieve his dream of completing his higher education.

loans.use: to pay for the fees needed to validate his diploma.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, de 41 años de edad , esta casada y tiene de dos hijos de 19 y 15 años respectivamente, vive en la casa de su madre junto a su familia.Alicia se dedica a la venta de carnes. Principalmente ofrece a la venta carne de cerdo y eventualmente carne de res , para esto consigue diariamente todo su producto en el centro de abastecimiento de carnes certificadas para el consumo humano. Tiene su puesto de ventas en uno de los principales mercados de la ciudad hasta donde traslada las carnes que ha solicitado previamente con un día de anticipación. La demanda por este tipo de carnes es alta lo cual le permite tener siempre buenas ventas diarias por lo cual pocas veces no a conseguido vender todo lo que ofrece al culminar el día. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el compañerismo que existe entre los comerciantes que trabajan en el mismo rubro que ella, ya que todos se apoyan mutuamente buscando conseguir nuevos clientes. Las ganancias que obtiene por sus ventas le ayudan a solventar los gastos de su hogar y además le permite ahorrar para algunos imprevistos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000 soles , está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante.Con el monto solicitado mejorará la infraestructura de su puesto de ventas y comprará mayor cantidad de carne de cerdo para que continúe trabajando.
texts.en:
Alicia is 41 years old, married, and has two children who are 15 and 19 years old.  She lives in her mother's house together with her family.  

Alicia works selling meats.  She mainly sells pork and eventually beef.  She gets her products every day from the supply center for meats certified for human consumption.  She has her sales stall in one of the main markets in the city where she transports the meats that she ordered the day before.  The demand for these types of meats is high which allows her to always have good daily sales.  Very few times has she not been able to sell all of her stock at the end of the day.  The thing she likes about her work is the camaraderie that exists among the merchants who work in the same area she does since they support each other in finding new customers.  The income she earns with her sales help meet her household expenses and allow her to save for something unexpected.

Currently she is requesting 3000 soles.  She is grateful for the opportunity provided and the financial support that she needs to continue forward.  With the loan requested, she will improve the infrastructure of her sales stall and purchase a larger quantity of pork so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to improve her stall's infrastructure and purchase meat.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene, de 27 años de edad, esta casada con Luis quien es operador técnico en un aserradero, vive junto a su pareja y su hija de 5 años en la casa que construyeron sus padres. El negocio que tiene Marlene es la venta de bebidas gasificadas y cervezas de diversas marcas y tamaños, lo cual realiza en la casa de sus padres ya que ahí instaló un pequeño bar para la atención a sus clientes. Su negocio lleva más de 6 años y ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa por tiempos prolongados para atender y cuidar a su pequeño hijo a quien desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, viendo lo lucrativo que es el negocio por la demanda que tiene, desea continuar con esta actividad y ampliarlo aún mas abriendo un minimarket en donde pueda vender otro tipo de productos orientados a este mismo rubro.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos.
Con el monto solicitado comprará bebidas gasificadas y cervezas en mayor cantidad de variadas marcas y presentaciones.
texts.en:
Marlene is 27 years old. She's married to Luis, who's a machine operator for a sawmill. She lives with her spouse and her 5-year-old daughter in the house that her parents built. Marlene's business is selling soft drinks and beer of various brands and sizes. She does this in her parents' house, since that's where she set up a small bar in order to serve her customers. She has run this business for over 6 years and it has gradually grown. She enjoys her business because it allows her to stay at home for longer periods of time so that she can look after and take care of her little son, whose living conditions she wishes to improve. She sees how profitable the business is because it's in high demand. She wishes to keep the business going and expand it even more by opening a small store where she can sell other types of products aimed at the same line of work. On this occasion she'll request 1500 soles, and for that reason she counts on your cooperation in order to move forward with her goals.
With the requested amount she'll purchase larger quantities of soft drinks and beer of various brands and types of packaging.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos de 48 años de edad, es padre de dos hijos. Asegura que su familia es la razón más importante para trabajar diariamente e ir en búsqueda de los ingresos necesarios para asegurarles una mejor calidad de vida. Desde hace más de ocho años se dedica a la fabricación de escobas y traperas, actividad que aprendió gracias a su padre y hoy se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos. Labora diariamente de siete de la mañana a ocho de la noche, en un pequeño taller ubicado en su residencia, los productos son distribuidos en los diferentes barrios de la Ciudad de Medellín.
Con el fin de aumentar sus ventas, Carlos se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de materia prima. Espera con esta inversión mejorar su condición económica y garantizarles a sus  hijos el acceso a la educación superior.
texts.en:
Carlos, 48, is the father of two children.  He says his family is the most important thing to work every day and look for the income he needs to make sure they have a better quality of life.

He has worked for many years making brooms and mops, which he learned thanks to his father and has become his only current source of income.  He works every day from 7 in the morning until 8 at night in a small workshop located in his residence.  He distributes the products in different neighborhoods in the city of Medellín.

Carlos wants to increase his sales  so he's requesting a loan to invest in buying raw materials.  He hopes to improve his financial situation and give his children access to a higher education with this investment.

loans.use: to buy materials to make brooms and mops

loans.name: Federico

texts.en: Federico is a responsible father who engages in a furniture-making business to generate additional income. He is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He aims to improve his business in order to generate sufficient income to support his family needs. He planned to make more finished products to sell, but he doesn't have enough capital. In this regard, he is asking for an additional of P8,000 to buy wood, varnish, and nails needed in furniture-making. Through his patience and strong determination, he believes that he will be able to improve his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish, and nails needed in furniture-making

location.town: Brgy. Tuao South, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcayaa

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is from Iraq. He is 24 years old, married, and a father of a single child.
Haydar owns a small grocery store where he sells all the daily goods of a house like canned food, dairy products, snacks, soft drinks, and detergents. He established his business in 2010 and had previous experience working at a grocery store as an employee. Now, Haydar is running his shop perfectly and has gained an excellent reputation.
Haydar is requesting a youth loan of 2,100 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent of his grocery store. With this loan, Haydar will be able to continue providing the family's income and provide them better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his grocery store

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 52 years old. She lives in the city of Batumi with her 55-year-old husband, 32-year-old son, her daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren who are going to school. Nadia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected, because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 
The family has a car. Nadia’s husband drives it as a taxi to earn a small daily income, which is the only source of income for the family.
Nadia requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program has provisions for business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Nadia will open a dining hall at the local school. She will cover the expenses for a license and purchase all the needed equipment. This business will not only help her to earn an additional income, but it will also provide students with a good lunch. With the increased income, Nadia will be able to cover their monthly expenses and provide better living conditions for her family members.

loans.use: To open a dining hall at the local school.

loans.name: Edwin Andrés

texts.es:
Edwin es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar por situaciones difíciles en el transcurso de su vida, sin embargo sus ganas de salir adelante le han permitido superar las dificultades y progresar junto a su familia. Debido a su carencia educativa el mundo laboral le cerró las puertas, por lo cual decidió montar su propio negocio de comidas rápidas y gracias a esta actividad ha podido generar los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 
Hoy es muy reconocido en el sector, debido a la calidad en el servicio. 
Con el propósito de aumentar sus ventas, desea adquirir al por mayor los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus comidas y realizar mejoras locativas con la compra de silletería y mesas. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que no cuenta con el capital suficiente. 
Edwin espera aumentar sus ingresos y ofrecerle a su  familia una mejor calidad de vida.  Su mayor sueño es tener un restaurante y convertirse en una fuente generadora de empleo en su localidad.
texts.en:
Edwin is somebody who has had to go through difficult situations throughout his life.  Nevertheless, his desire to get ahead has allowed him to overcome his difficulties and make progress with his family.  Because he lacked an education doors in the work world were closed for him, so he decided to set up his own fast-food business.  Thanks to this job he has been able to generate enough income to support his household.  Today he's very well known in the business because of the quality of his service.

With the goal of increasing his sales he wants to acquire wholesale the supplies he needs to make his dishes as well as make improvements on his locale by buying chairs and tables.  He doesn't have enough capital so he's requesting a loan.

Edwin hopes to increase his income and give his family a better quality of life.  His biggest dream is to have a restaurant that becomes a source of jobs in his town.

loans.use: to buy supplies, chairs, and tables

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
This is Eleanor. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store, and she was able to generate more income. She has been in this business for seven years now. She is already a widow, and she is working hard to provide income for her everyday needs. 
She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
Eleanor dreams that her business will be bigger and that she will have another branch. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien is 51 years old. He is married to a farmer, and they have seven children. He has requested a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs to have a better rice production. With the profits, he will provide any basic needs to his family for better living in the future.
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a widow with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 
Jumwa  has been operating a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 30 years of age. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 
She has been operating a tailoring business, making both men's and women's suits. In addition, she also operates a café business, which earns her more income. She sells at the market to local neighbors and passersby. 
With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials, thread, and sewing needles. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, thread, and sewing needles

loans.name: Elia

texts.en:
Elia is 34 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have six children. He has requested a Kiva loanto buy more fertilizer and pay for labor during rice production. With the profits, he will provide for the basic needs of his family for better living in the future. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pay for labor during rice production.

loans.name: Aphrodis

texts.en:
Aphrodis is 31 years old. He is married to a farmer, and they have three children. He has been a rice farmer for 16 years. He has requested a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and pay labor costs to have a better rice production. With the profits, he will provide any basic needs to his family for better living in the future. 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en: Baigalmaa, 47, lives with her husband and 3 children in a ger in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband Hohoo helps his wife to run their family cafeteria. Her children Anhbolor, 23, and Ganzorig, 21, are university students and Gantulga, 17, is a senior student at a local secondary school. The borrower has been running her cafeteria business since 1998. This is their family business and covers their family expenses and their children's education fees. She is now requesting 5,000,000 MNT to pay her children's spring semester tuition and purchase extra equipment for her cafeteria from Ulaanbaatar so that she can run her business more smoothly. She is a hardworking, enthusiastic and strong woman.

loans.use: to pay her children's spring semester tuition and purchase extra equipment for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Enelsa

texts.en:
Enelsa is a 31-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has two children. The oldest is 15, and the youngest is six years old. She engages in bamboo selling. She has been in this business for two years now. This is the source of her income.
Enelsa is requesting a loan for additional capital to purchase bamboo. Bamboo can be used for fences, sticks, and bamboo matting. With this loan, she can purchase bamboo, and then she can sell it to her customer. 
In the future, Enelsa hopes to expand her business and have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single, 26-year-old woman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
For the past three years, she has operated a coconut-selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high transportation costs. She dreams of expanding her business to improve her living standards. 
With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and medicine

loans.name: Nadhira

texts.en: Nadhira is a 47-year-old married woman with children. She is a hardworking woman who lives in Taiz, Yemen. She has been running a grocery store for many years. She thanks Kiva for financing her in the first loan, and she intends to expand her business to increase her profit. She applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy new products for her grocery store. She hopes to be financed in the second loan.

loans.use: to buy new products for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Sigyongyaakadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme Safiatou est la représentante du groupe SIGYONGYAAKADI. Elle se porte bien ainsi que sa famille. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 6ans. Les 03 vont a l’école.
Elle vend des pagnes  et aussi des produits de beauté depuis 2007. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter 05 pièces de pagnes  et des boites de pommades.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut mieux s’occuper de sa famille. Elle ambitionne aider son mari à construire leur maison et agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Safiatou is the representative of the SIGYONGYAAKADI group.  She and her family are doing well.  She is married and the mother of three children.  Her oldest child is 15 years old, the youngest is 6.  All three go to school.

Safiatou has been selling "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) and cosmetics since 2007.  She buys her goods at the District 10 market and sells to both men and women.

She wants to buy five pagnes and some boxes of ointment.

She wants to use her profits to take better care of her family.  Her goal is to help her husband with the construction of their house, and also to expand her own business.

loans.use: to buy five "pagnes" and some boxes of ointment.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Mme SOLANGE représente le groupe BADEYA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. Les 03 vont à l’école.
Mme fait la restauration (vente d’atiéké) depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de KILWIN. Ses clients sont les habitants du quartier (hommes, femmes et enfants).
Elle veut s’acheter 40sachets d’atiéké (couscous de manioc).
Avec ses bénéfices, elle désire épargner. Mme ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille  et ouvrir un restaurant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Solange is the representative of the Badeya group. She is well. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 17 years old and the youngest is 6 years old. The three of them attend school. 

Mrs. Solange has been in the catering business (selling atiéké) for 10 years. She gets her supplies from the Kilwin market. Her customers are residents of the neighborhood (men, women and children).
She would like to buy 40 small bags of atiéké  (cassava couscous). With her profit she would like to save up. Her ambition is to improve her family’s living condition and open a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy 40 pouches of atiéké (cassava couscous)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beehives

loans.name: Gloria Cecilia

texts.es:
Gloria de 31 años de edad, es madre de un hijo de 10 años,  al cual sueña con brindarle lo mejor. Trabajó como operaria en un taller de confección, pero al observar la explotación a la que era sometida y la mala remuneración. Decidió  montar su propio taller de confección. Hoy lleva dos años con la actividad y se dedica principalmente a la confección de terceros. Su mayor sueño es convertirse en una fuente generadora de empleo en su localidad.
En la actualidad han incrementando los pedidos, por lo cual requiere de la compra de una máquina plana debido a que la que posee actualmente se encuentra en muy mal estado. 
Desea que su taller siga creciendo y le genere los ingresos necesarios para ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida, una buena educación y una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
31-year-old Gloria is the mother of a 10-year-old boy, and she dreams of offering him more. She worked as an operator in a tailoring workshop, but observing the exploitation she was subjected to and the poor remuneration, she decided to start her own tailoring workshop. 

She has now been doing it for two years and she mainly works for other tailoring businesses. Her greatest dream is to become a source of employment in her area. Currently the orders are increasing, so she needs to buy a tabletop sewing machine because the one she has at the moment is in very bad condition. 

She wants her workshop to keep growing and generate the necessary income for her to offer her son a better quality of life, a good education and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine

loans.name: Julio Rodolfo

texts.es: Julio de 41 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hija en casa propia, es un hombre responsable y trabajador se dedica a la siembra de maiz y sorgo desde hace 8 años almacena sus cosechas en los graneros que se muestran en la foto para luego salir a comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar a su familia. Don Julio solicita un credito para poder comprar insumos agricolas como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes entre otras cosas que se necesitan para la siembra, y asi poder tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Julio is 41 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a house he owns. He is responsible and hardworking, dedicated to plant corn and sorghum. He has stored his crops in the barn shown in the picture for the last eight years. Then, he goes to sell in the various markets near the place where he lives. With the profits obtained he manages to cover the expenses of his family. 

Julio is requesting a loan so he can buy agricultural supplies such as seeds and fertilizers, among other things he needs for planting. Doing so, he will have a better income and he will be able to give more stability to his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to plant corn and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy modern beehives.

loans.name: Helber

texts.es:
Helber de 27 años de edad, desde muy joven se ha visto en la necesidad de trabajar, debido a que a sus 20 años se convirtió en padre, lo que implicó buscar el sustento no sólo para el si no para su núcleo familiar.
Con su experiencia en las actividades agrícolas, adquirida desde su infancia y juventud, Helber logró conseguir una parcela en la que siembra cultivo de fríjol y arveja y gracias al desarrollo de su actividad obtiene los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas con el fin de mejorar su producción y sacar una buena cosecha que le permita mejorar sus ingresos y garantizarle a su familia condiciones de vida digna.
texts.en: Helber is 27 years old and has had to work out necessity from a young age. He became a father at 20, which led him to look for a livelihood for not only himself but his young family. With his experience in farming activities, something he learned from infancy, Helber was able to get a plot of land to plant beans and peas, and thanks to developing this activity he earns the necessary income for his family's daily bread. He is requesting the loan to invest in farming supplies with the goal of improving his production and getting a good harvest to allow him to increase his income and guarantee his family decent living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Lely

texts.es: Lely, de 51 años de edad, está casada con Elías quien es técnico dental, vive en compañía de su esposo, su hija de 18 años  de edad y su dos nietos, instalados cómodamente en su casa propia.El negocio que tiene Lely es la confección de ropas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños de todos los modelos, para eso se inició con una modesta maquina de coser . Tiene su taller instalado en su casa , desde alli atiende a todos sus clientes de manera amable y cordial, quienes terminan satisfechos con el buen trabajo que realiza. Estudió costura en un centro de educación ocupacional y fue así como decidió emprender este negocio. Desde entonces han pasado 10 años y actualmente tiene 3 maquinas de coser. Trabaja con la ayuda de su hija quien también siente mucha afición por esta actividad.Le gusta su oficio pues le permite plasmar toda su creatividad y manifestarlas en cada una de las prendas que elabora, además le agrada el ingreso económico que obtiene por su labor ya que le sirve para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500 soles, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes.Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales de confección como agujas de maquinas, hilos, telas, elásticos, botones y otros.
texts.en:
Lely is 51 years old and is married to Elías, who is a dental technician. She lives with her husband, her daughter who is 18 years old and her two grandchildren, comfortably in their own house. Lely's business is dressmaking of all patterns of clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children. She began with a single sewing machine. She has her workshop in her house, from where she servers all her customers in a friendly and cordial way. They are very happy with the good work she does.

She studied sewing in an occupational education center, and then she decided to start her business. Since then it's been 10 years, and she currently has three sewing machines. She works with the help of her daughter who also loves this activity. She likes her job because it allows her to capture all her creativity and show it in each of the clothing she makes. Also, she likes the income she gets from her job since it helps her husband to support the household expenses. 

This time, she will request 2,5000 soles, for what she needs cooperation to realize her plans. With the amount requested, she will buy clothing materials such as machine needles, thread, fabric, elastic, buttons, and other.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials such as needles, thread, fabrics, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 15 outfits for adults and 15 outfits for children.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a married woman age 30 years. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments in the future. She dreams of expanding to a café business.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Ganpurev

texts.en:
Ms.Ganpurev is a 40-year-old widow and lives with her son, daughter, and mother in Darkhan city. She lives with her family in a rental apartment that is located in the local district of Darkhan city. She has been operating a shoe sales stall business at the local market since 2003. Now she has about 3,000,000 Mongolian Tughriks (MNT) in working capital. 

In the future, she really wants to increase her working capital and improve her business. Therefore she is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more shoes to sell at her stall.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.es: Jennifer de 26 años de edad, se dedicó al oficio de la confección desde sus 14 años, cuando quedó embarazada. El padre nunca se hizo responsable, por lo cual debió hacerse cargo del bienestar y las necesidades de su hijo. Laboró por varios años en este sector y desde hace dos años decidió retirarse y montar su propio taller en su vivienda con el fin de compartir más tiempo con sus dos hijos de 12 y 9 años de edad. Su mayor sueño es brindarle a su familia una mejor educación y garantizarles mejores oportunidades de vida, razón por la cual lucha por conseguir un mayor número de clientes que le generen mejores ingresos. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una máquina recubridora y una plana con el propósito de incrementar su producción y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jennifer is 26 and has been a dressmaker since she was 14 years old, when she became pregnant. The father never took responsibility, so she had to be in charge of the needs and well being of her son. She worked for several years in this sector and for the past two years, decided to break away and set up her own workshop in her home so that she can spend more time with her two children, ages 12 and 9. Her biggest dream is to provide her family with a good education and guarantee them better opportunities in life, which is her reason for working hard to gain a more customers, allowing her to earn more income. She is currently requesting a loan that she will invest in a surger sewing machine and a level. Her goal is to increase production and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a serger sewing machine and a level

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 40 years old. She is a mother of five children. She has spent 22 years as a rice farmer. Francoise has requested a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to get enough rice output. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).
